articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Trump 'to announce Paris climate deal pullout'
articles.description: President Trump is due to announce plans to withdraw from the Paris climate agreement, US media say.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Trump 'to pull US out of Paris climate change deal'
articles.description: President Trump is poised to break ranks with nearly 200 countries because the pact is a "bad deal".

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Jeremy Corbyn and Theresa May clash over post-Brexit Britain
articles.description: Labour and Tory leaders say what they want for post-Brexit Britain - with a week to go to polling day.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Resorts World Manila: Shooting heard at leisure complex
articles.description: Gunfire and blasts are reported at a hotel complex near Manila airport in the Philippines.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Manchester attack: Saffie Roussos mum 'told of her death'
articles.description: The mother and sister of Manchester attack victim Saffie Roussos are now said to be "out of danger".

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Manchester attack: Lead children's surgeon 'angry'
articles.description: Dr Ibrar Majid, who saved lives on the night of the attack, on his feelings as a Muslim for the bomber.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Manchester One Love concert: 'Thousands make false ticket claims'
articles.description: Ticketmaster says 10,000 "unscrupulous" people applied for free tickets for a benefit concert.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Champions Trophy: Joe Root hits a century as England beat Bangladesh
articles.description: Joe Root makes an unbeaten 133 and Alex Hales hits 95 as England cruise to an eight-wicket win over Bangladesh in their Champions Trophy opener.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Coronation Street actor Roy Barraclough dies aged 81
articles.description: The actor, who played Alec Gilroy in the soap, dies at the age of 81 after a short illness.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Nigel Farage: Russia claims are preposterous
articles.description: Nigel Farage dismisses a report that he is a "person of interest" in an FBI investigation into Russia.
